    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • addRecords

        public static void addRecords(java.io.PrintWriter pw)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        This method will add the line for appending information. It will prompt that if user wants to add new information or not. Furthermore, newly added ISBN should be greater than recorded ISBN so we use method traceGreatestISBN
        Parameters:
        pw - output file stream name.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • traceGreatestISBN

        private static long traceGreatestISBN(java.lang.String in)
        We can know how many lines with howManyRecords method so last line has greatest ISBN since text file is sorted ISBN order. So we simply get the last ISBN.
        Parameters:
        in - this parameter is used for reading file name.
        Returns:
        the greatest number of ISBN in text file (which are sorted by ISBN order)

      • howManyRecords

        private static int howManyRecords(java.lang.String in)
        Similar method as first part of assignment, it will find how many records there is (input parameter is String).
        Parameters:
        in - Reading file name to search how many lines there is
        Returns:
        return the number of lines.

      • displayFileContents

        public static void displayFileContents(java.io.BufferedReader br)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Since the question asks to use BufferedReader, I will use BufferedReader instead of Scanner. It will simply display file contents. Similar method as first part of assignment.
        Parameters:
        br - input stream file name (buffered reader)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • recordInArray

        private static void recordInArray()
        This method will help to record all the array. Since bkArr is static so we don't need to use input method.

      • binaryBookSearch

        public static int binaryBookSearch(Book[] bk,
                                   int s,
                                   int e,
                                   long ISBN)
        This method will do binary search in bkArr. Please note that our index is start from 1 not 0!
        Parameters:
        bk - entered Book array
        s - start index
        e - end index
        ISBN - the ISBN that user is searching for
        Returns:
        returning -1 or found index value.

      • sequentialBookSearch

        public static int sequentialBookSearch(Book[] bk,
                                       int s,
                                       int e,
                                       long ISBN)
        This method will do sequential search in bkArr. Please note that our index is start from 1 not 0!
        Parameters:
        bk - entered Book array
        s - start index
        e - end index
        ISBN - the ISBN that user is searching for
        Returns:
        returning -1 or found index value.

      • binaryWriting

        public static void binaryWriting(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        This will store all the objects from the bkArr[] into a binary file. Note that we do not need to use writeUTF, writeLong... etc since the question asks to store all the <> from bkArr[]
        Parameters:
        oos - binary output stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
